statement: Countries do not have the right to choose their residents but that people have the right to choose where they live.
It should be the norm that those seeking asylum should receive a permanent residence permit.
We should incentivize migrants currently residing in the country to leave.
Continuing our open migration policy makes Sweden a better country.
Further regulating Sweden's current migration policy to align with national interests is needed.
Immigrants and asylum seekers should be able to access welfare benefits.
It is important that we continue to have a single-payer healthcare system.
So long as our healthcare remains universal, there is nothing wrong with having private health comapnies operating within our health services.
Private, for-profit companies operating within our health services should be banned.
We should allow same-sex marriages.
Current rules which makes healthcare universal, should also apply to dental care.
We should continue to have charter schools in our education service.
It is necessary to introduce stronger profit constraints on private entities operating within our education service.
Same-sex couples should have the same adoption rights as heterosexual couples.
Niqabs should be banned from schools.
It is important that the central government take back responsibility of managing our schools from municipalities.
Education should emphasize more on teaching traditional values.
The welfare state must be protected.
There should be a green tax shift that lowers taxes on work and increases taxes on environmentally damaging activities.
It is necessary that there should be a zero-tolernce policy towards crime. including minor crimes.
There should be greater civic oversight within our police services.
Begging should be banned.
Police should have greater access to camera surveillance.
There should be extra taxes levied on large fortunes.
There should be an additional air tax on travel to protect the environment.
Tuition for post-secondary education should be universal and funded through general taxation.
We should allow for the creation of entry-level jobs at 70% of normal pay.
We need to encourage more entrepreneurship through streamlining regulations and lower taxes.
The working day should be lowered from 8 hours to 6 hours.
The retirement age should be raised from 61 to 63.
